alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued March 02 at 1:34PM EST until March 05 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SUNDAY EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM FRIDAY TO 4 AM EST SATURDAY... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM FRIDAY TO 7 AM EST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, minor coastal flooding expected. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet expected along St George Island. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Coastal Franklin County. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 AM Friday to 4 AM EST Saturday. For the High Surf Advisory, from 4 PM Friday to 7 AM EST Saturday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Sunday evening. * IMPACTS...Expect peak water levels of 1 to 2 feet above normally dry ground along the coast around the time of high tide. Impacts at these water levels often flood boat ramps around Apalachicola and result in minor overwash along Alligator Point Road. High tide at Apalachicola is at 334 pm ET on Friday and again at 1232 am ET Saturday. Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion are expected. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
